episodeTitle: The Hidden Past! Female Fighter Bell-mère!
episodeTitleJapanese: 秘められた過去！女戦士ベルメール！
description: Nojiko tells the Straw Hat crew about Nami's tragic past. Through flashbacks, we learn how Bell-mère, a former Marine, found and adopted baby Nami and young Nojiko during a war in the Oykot Kingdom. Despite financial hardships, Bell-mère raised the girls with love in Cocoyasi Village. The episode ends with the arrival of the Arlong Pirates, who demand tribute from all villagers and threaten the peaceful life Bell-mère built for her daughters.

events.title: Nojiko Begins Telling Nami's Past
events.description: In the present day at Arlong Park, Nojiko begins recounting Nami's tragic backstory to the Straw Hat crew, explaining why Nami has been working for Arlong all these years.
events.significance: This is the beginning of one of the most emotional backstories in One Piece, providing crucial context for Nami's character and her seemingly traitorous actions.

quotes.text: I'll tell you about Nami's past.
quotes.speaker: Nojiko
quotes.context: Nojiko decides to reveal the truth to the Straw Hats

events.title: Bell-mère's First Appearance
events.description: In a flashback set 20 years ago during a war in the Oykot Kingdom, we meet Bell-mère, a young Marine soldier who has been severely wounded in battle and is lying among the dead.
events.significance: This introduces one of the most beloved mother figures in One Piece and sets up the emotional core of Nami's backstory.

quotes.text: I guess this is it... I'm going to die here.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère accepts her fate on the battlefield

events.title: Young Nojiko and Baby Nami Discovered
events.description: Bell-mère discovers a young girl (Nojiko) carrying a crying baby (Nami) among the ruins of the battlefield. Seeing the baby's smile gives Bell-mère the will to live again.
events.significance: This is the moment that changes Bell-mère's life and establishes the family bond between Bell-mère, Nami, and Nojiko. Nami's smile literally saves Bell-mère's life.

quotes.text: This baby... she's smiling. Even in this hell, she's smiling at me.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère sees baby Nami smile and decides to live

events.title: Bell-mère Returns to Cocoyasi Village with the Girls
events.description: Bell-mère returns from the war to Cocoyasi Village with the two orphaned girls, declaring her intention to raise them as her own daughters despite everyone's concerns about her troubled past.
events.significance: Establishes Cocoyasi Village as Nami's home and shows Bell-mère's determination to give the girls a loving home despite her limited means.

quotes.text: I'm going to raise these girls myself!
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère announces her decision to adopt Nami and Nojiko

events.title: Mummy Mee and Daddy Dee Debut
events.description: The houseparents of a World Government orphanage, Mummy Mee and Daddy Dee, try to convince Bell-mère to give the children to their facility instead of raising them herself.
events.significance: Shows the community's doubt in Bell-mère's ability to raise children, and highlights her determination to keep her family together.

events.title: Genzo's Pinwheel Origin
events.description: Genzo, the village sheriff, attaches a pinwheel to his hat to make baby Nami laugh, as his stern face would otherwise make her cry. This becomes his signature look.
events.significance: Establishes the origin of Genzo's iconic pinwheel and shows his fatherly affection for Nami. This pinwheel later becomes part of Nami's tattoo design.

events.title: Bell-mère's Difficult Life as a Single Mother
events.description: The episode shows Bell-mère's struggles as a single mother farming mikans. When mikan prices drop, she feeds the girls proper meals while eating only mikans herself, claiming she's on a 'diet.'
events.significance: Demonstrates Bell-mère's selfless love and sacrifice for her daughters, despite their poverty. This establishes the emotional foundation for Nami's character.

quotes.text: I'm on a diet, so I'm just eating mikans!
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère lies to her daughters to hide that she can't afford food for herself

events.title: Young Nami's Dream of World Cartography
events.description: Young Nami expresses her dream of drawing a map of the entire world. Due to their poverty, she steals cartography books from the local bookstore to study.
events.significance: Reveals the origin of Nami's passion for cartography and navigation, which becomes central to her character and her forced servitude to Arlong.

quotes.text: I want to draw a map of the whole world!
quotes.speaker: Nami (child)
quotes.context: Young Nami reveals her dream to Bell-mère

events.title: Nami's Outburst About Not Being Real Family
events.description: During an argument about money and clothes, young Nami cruelly tells Bell-mère 'You're not even my real mother!' in a moment of childish anger before running away upset.
events.significance: This creates profound regret for Nami, as these become the last words she speaks to Bell-mère before Arlong's arrival. This moment haunts Nami throughout her life.

quotes.text: You're not even my real mother!
quotes.speaker: Nami (child)
quotes.context: Nami's hurtful words to Bell-mère during an argument about poverty

events.title: Bell-mère's Words of Wisdom
events.description: Bell-mère comforts Nojiko, explaining that despite their poverty, they can still find happiness. She shares her philosophy that as long as you're alive, happy times will come.
events.significance: This philosophy becomes a core theme of Nami's character and the Arlong Park arc. It represents Bell-mère's optimistic spirit despite hardship.

quotes.text: If you survive, happy times will come your way.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère's life philosophy that sustains Nami through years of suffering

events.title: Arlong Pirates Arrive at Cocoyasi Village
events.description: The Arlong Pirates, led by the fearsome fish-man Arlong, arrive at Cocoyasi Village. Arlong declares the entire Conomi Islands as his territory and announces his rule.
events.significance: This marks the beginning of 8 years of tyranny over Cocoyasi Village and directly leads to Bell-mère's death and Nami's enslavement. This is the inciting incident for Nami's entire character arc.

quotes.text: This island now belongs to the Arlong Pirates!
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong announces his dominion over Cocoyasi Village

events.title: Arlong Announces the Tribute System
events.description: Arlong declares that all residents of the Conomi Islands must pay a monthly tribute: 100,000 berries for adults and 50,000 berries for children. Those who cannot pay will be killed.
events.significance: This establishes the oppressive system that terrorizes the village for 8 years and sets up Bell-mère's impossible choice in the next episode.

quotes.text: Adults pay 100,000 berries. Children pay 50,000 berries. Those who cannot pay... will die!
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong announces his brutal tribute system

events.title: Smoke Rising from Bell-mère's House
events.description: As Nami and Nojiko return to the village, they see smoke rising from the direction of their home, where Arlong's crew is conducting their tribute collection.
events.significance: This cliffhanger ending sets up the devastating events of the next episode and Bell-mère's ultimate sacrifice.

events.title: Luffy's Group Encounters Arlong Pirates Officers
events.description: In the present timeline, Hatchan, Kuroobi, and Chew investigate reports of a flying ship and encounter Luffy taking a walk in the area.
events.significance: Sets up confrontations between the Straw Hats and Arlong's officers, providing a brief present-day interlude between flashback scenes.

quotes.text: I'll tell you about Nami's past.
quotes.speaker: Nojiko
quotes.context: Nojiko decides to reveal the truth about Nami's childhood to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: This baby... she's smiling. Even in this hell, she's smiling at me.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère discovers baby Nami and finds her will to live

quotes.text: I'm going to raise these girls myself!
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère's declaration to adopt Nami and Nojiko

quotes.text: If you survive, happy times will come your way.
quotes.speaker: Bell-mère
quotes.context: Bell-mère's philosophy that sustains Nami through her darkest times

quotes.text: You're not even my real mother!
quotes.speaker: Nami (child)
quotes.context: Nami's regrettable last words to Bell-mère before the Arlong Pirates arrive

quotes.text: I want to draw a map of the whole world!
quotes.speaker: Nami (child)
quotes.context: Young Nami reveals her lifelong dream

quotes.text: Adults pay 100,000 berries. Children pay 50,000 berries. Those who cannot pay... will die!
quotes.speaker: Arlong
quotes.context: Arlong establishes his brutal tribute system

themes.description: The episode powerfully depicts Bell-mère's unconditional love for her adopted daughters, showing how she sacrifices her own needs to provide for them despite crushing poverty.
themes.symbolism: Bell-mère eating only mikans while feeding the girls proper meals symbolizes parental sacrifice. The mikan farm itself represents the fruits of her labor and love.

themes.description: The episode explores the theme that family is defined by love and choice, not blood. Bell-mère chooses to be a mother to orphaned children, and their bond is as strong as any biological family.
themes.symbolism: Nami's cruel words 'You're not even my real mother!' create dramatic irony, as Bell-mère is about to prove just how real her love is.

themes.description: Bell-mère's philosophy that 'if you survive, happy times will come' represents unwavering optimism in the face of hardship, a recurring theme in One Piece.
themes.symbolism: Baby Nami's smile in the midst of a war-torn battlefield represents innocence and hope that can exist even in the darkest circumstances.

themes.description: Young Nami's dream to map the entire world is established, showing her ambition and curiosity that will drive her character throughout the series.
themes.symbolism: Nami stealing books to pursue her dream foreshadows her later 'thievery' and her willingness to do whatever it takes to achieve her goals.

themes.description: Arlong's arrival and tribute system represents systematic oppression, showing how tyrants use fear and economic control to dominate populations.
themes.symbolism: The tribute system represents the crushing weight of tyranny that prevents people from living freely.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist of flashback; Nami's adoptive mother
characterSpotlights.development: We meet Bell-mère and learn about her transformation from a wounded Marine ready to die to a loving mother determined to raise two orphaned girls despite poverty and hardship.
keyActions: Discovers baby Nami and young Nojiko on a battlefield
Decides to live and bring the girls home
Adopts the girls despite community concerns
Sacrifices her own meals to feed her daughters
Shares her life philosophy with the girls
quotes: I'm going to raise these girls myself!
If you survive, happy times will come your way.

characterSpotlights.role: Central figure of flashback; shown as a child
characterSpotlights.development: We learn about Nami's origins as a war orphan, her adoption by Bell-mère, and the development of her cartography dream. Her complicated feelings about poverty and family are revealed.
keyActions: Smiles as a baby, giving Bell-mère will to live
Expresses her dream to map the world
Says hurtful words to Bell-mère during argument
quotes: I want to draw a map of the whole world!
You're not even my real mother!

characterSpotlights.role: Narrator in present day; Bell-mère's older adopted daughter
characterSpotlights.development: Nojiko serves as the storyteller, revealing her sister's past to the Straw Hats. In flashbacks, we see her as a protective older sister who understands their family's struggles.
keyActions: Begins telling Nami's story to the crew
Carried baby Nami through war zone as a young child
quotes: I'll tell you about Nami's past.

characterSpotlights.development: Arlong is introduced in flashback as the fearsome fish-man pirate who conquers Cocoyasi Village and establishes a brutal tribute system.
keyActions: Arrives at Cocoyasi Village with his crew
Declares the Conomi Islands as his territory
Announces the tribute system of 100,000/50,000 berries
quotes: This island now belongs to the Arlong Pirates!
Adults pay 100,000 berries. Children pay 50,000 berries. Those who cannot pay... will die!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on several scenes showing daily life with Bell-mère and the girls, adding more emotional depth to their relationship.
Additional scenes of Luffy and the crew in present day were added to break up the flashback sequence.

trivia.fact: This episode has an IMDb rating of 8.2/10, one of the highest-rated episodes in the East Blue Saga.
4Kids Entertainment combined Japanese episodes 35 and 36 into a single 4Kids episode 34 in their English dub.
The Oykot Kingdom, where Bell-mère found Nami and Nojiko, is 'Tokyo' spelled backwards.
This episode marks the debut of Mummy Mee and Daddy Dee, houseparents of a World Government orphanage.
Bell-mère's height of 186 cm (6'1") makes her notably tall, especially for a female character in the East Blue.
Genzo's pinwheel, first shown in this episode, later becomes part of Nami's post-Arlong tattoo design, combined with a mikan to represent both him and Bell-mère.
